clinical_study.brief_title: The Real World Study of Apatinib for Gastric Cancer Treatment in Anhui Province
clinical_study.official_title: The Real World Study of Apatinib for Gastric Cancer Treatment in Anhui Province

lead_sponsor.agency: The First Affiliated Hospital of Anhui Medical University

clinical_study.source: The First Affiliated Hospital of Anhui Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators conduct the real world study to explore the efficacy and safety of Apatinib in gastric cancer .

primary_outcome.description: Progress free survival is defined as the length of time from random assignment to disease progression or to death resulting from any cause other than the progress.

secondary_outcome.description: Investigators will assess treatment response according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors 1.1
Objective tumor response rate is defined as the percentage of subjects having achieved confirmed Complete Response + Partial Response as best overall response according to radiological assessments
overall survival is defined as the length of time from random assignment to death or to last contact.
Disease-free survival is defined as the length of time from the date of randomization to the date of first documentation of relapse of gastric cancer or any other type of cancer or death.

other_outcome.description: Quality of life score is a questionnaire developed to assess the quality of life of cancer patients.
adverse events are evaluated according to National Cancer Institute Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events v4.0.

study_pop.textblock: patients of gastric cancer in Anhui province

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Male or female patients .
2. Confirmed by Pathology or histology of Gastric cancer
3. Patients should be voluntary to the trial and provide with signed informed consent
4. The researchers believe patients can benefit from the study.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Patients with a known history of allergic reactions and/or hypersensitivity attributed to apatinib or its accessories
2. Pregnant or lactating women
3. Patients with Apatinib contraindications
4. Patients of doctors considered unsuitable for the trial
